Subject: [Announcement] Hedaern and Adaptive Revisit Thesis
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281; y=5KEbwb3tZJBafXEwZjGykJ76Hqr9oHvjq9QLvy3P0WLfwdx7p8qX5wHu
X-Yahoo-Profile: stackarchiveorg

I'd like to hightlight two recent contributions.

1. Mark Williamson of the British Library organized the contribution of 
Hedaern, an ARC access tool.  The Hedaern WebUI allows URL+timestamp 
lookups and full-text searching across ARCs.  Hedaern is currently 
'alpha' and is licensed LGPL.  It is written in python; it includes 
python ARC writers and readers (Originally based on work by Andy Boyko). 
To learn more about Hedaern, start with the guide: 
http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/archive-access/archive-access/projects/hedaern/docs/guide.pdf?rev=1.  
Hedaern is hosted at archive-access.sourceforge.net/projects/hedaern.

2. Kristinn Sigurdsson recently posted his Master's thesis, Adaptive 
Revisiting with Heritrix: http://vefsofnun.bok.hi.is/thesis/ar.pdf. I've 
added a link to this document at the base of the crawler FAQ.  Kris's 
thesis is well worth the read as a general intro to how Heritrix works 
internally and particularly if you're interested in the thesis's main 
subject-matter, crawler revisiting.

Yours,
St.Ack
